sentence.Network_en: In 1901, he broke out of vaudeville and set his sights on Broadway.
sentence.Network_cn: 1901年，他放弃了杂耍表演，决定到百老汇发展。

sentence.Network_en: In 1925 Burns met the vaudeville actress Grace ( Gracie ) Allen, whom he married the following year.
sentence.Network_cn: 1925年,伯恩斯邂逅另一位轻喜剧女演员格雷斯 ( 格雷西 ) -艾伦, 于次年结婚.

sentence.Network_en: Tell her you're abdul abdullah who used to be a mind reader in vaudeville.
sentence.Network_cn: 告诉她你是阿布·阿度拉,常常在杂技团表演读心术.

list.abs: The room was decorated with pictures of vaudeville celebrities ., 这个房间有轻歌舞剧明星的照片装饰.
...|泰特, 和Edmund Wilson|威尔森等。以H. L. Mencken|门肯为例，白璧德给他冠上「知性杂耍」（intellectual vaudeville）的标签──这样的批评容易引起后世同情。1921年白璧德获选为American Academy of Arts and Scien.
Three American vaudeville entertainers become involved with spies in Hong Kong , just before Pearl Harbor ., 三位美国杂耍艺人在珍珠港事件前夕卷入香港间谍的活动.
The mayor talks like a vaudeville comedian in his public addresses ., 在公共演讲中 , 这位市长讲起话来像个歌舞杂耍演员.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 18th cent.: from French, earlier vau de ville (or vire), said to be a name given originally to songs composed by Olivier Basselin, a 15th-cent. fuller born in Vau de Vire in Normandy

entry.tran: 歌舞杂耍表演,综艺节目（尤流行于20世纪初）
entry.def: Vaudeville is a type of entertainment consisting of short acts such as comedy, singing, and dancing. Vaudeville was especially popular in the early part of the twentieth century.

example.ex: In 1901, he broke out of vaudeville and set his sights on Broadway.
example.tran: 1901年，他放弃了杂耍表演，决定到百老汇发展。

means.word_mean: 1. a variety show with songs and comic acts etc.
